content: President Donald Trump's campaign continued its legal blitz across key battleground states Thursday, homing in on Pennsylvania with state judges denying or dismissing lawsuits in Georgia and Michigan… [+8518 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: The Associated Press and Caitlin Yoshiko Kandil
title: Kai Kahele is second Native Hawaiian in Congress since statehood in 1959
description: Kahele is the second Native Hawaiian in Congress since its statehood and made Native Hawaiian and indigenous rights a key issue in his campaign.
content:
HONOLULU (AP) Only one Native Hawaiian has represented the state in Congress since it first became a state in 1959. That's changing with Sen. Kaiali'i Kahele.
Kahele won the Hawaii House seat being … [+2703 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Dan Avery
title: Nevada becomes first state to recognize gay marriage in state constitution
description: A question on the Nevada ballot asked voters whether they support an amendment recognizing marriage “as between couples regardless of gender.”
content:
Nevada voters overturned an 18-year-old ban on same-sex marriage, making the state the first to enshrine gay couples right to marry in its constitution.
Question 2 on Nevada ballots asked voters whe… [+3709 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Protests in Arizona as vote count ongoing
description: Protesters in Maricopa County say they believe the election is being stolen from President Trump, without any evidence. Poll workers are working to tabulate about 275,000 remaining ballots.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump campaign announces federal lawsuit in Nevada over vote count
description: The Trump campaign alleges thousands of illegitimate votes were counted, including from dead people and out-of-state voters. The campaign did not take questions and did not provide evidence at the press conference.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Georgia vote count ongoing in close Trump-Biden race
description: Across the state, there are still nearly 47,000 outstanding votes as Joe Biden trails President Trump by fewer than 10,000. State officials aren’t making promises on when the count will be finished.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Election anxiety mounts as Pennsylvania continues to count votes
description: Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar says most votes will be counted by the end of the day. Philadelphia and the suburbs around it are where most of the uncounted votes remain.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Where the Trump campaign’s election legal challenges stand
description: A Pennsylvania appeals court ruled Trump campaign observers could get a closer view of the vote count in Philadelphia. Elsewhere was a day of setbacks and retreats as election law experts say it’s too late to make a legal claim that mail-in ballots were wrong…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump tweets baseless accusation of fraud as vote count continues
description: Lawsuits in Michigan and Georgia were dismissed because judges say there was no evidence of wrongdoing. President Trump has tweeted accusations of fraud without evidence.
source.name: NBC News

title: NBA hopes some fans will be in arenas when the 2020-21 season tips off
description: The NBA hopes to have fans in the stands and luxury suites, even if just a few, when the league starts its 2020-21 season.
content:

description: A federal judge ordered the Postal Service to continue its sweep of mail facilities in states that have extended ballot delivery deadlines, like North Carolina and Pennsylvania.

author: NBCNews.com
title: Biden predicts victory in 2020 race
description: With the election still too close to call, Joe Biden spoke out near his home in Delaware saying, “We have no doubt that when the count is finished, Senator Harris and I will be declared the winners.”
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Pa. secretary of state says 'hundreds of thousands' of ballots left to be counted
description: Pennsylvania Secretary of State Kathy Boockvar provided an update on the ballot count in the Keystone State, reporting there are “hundreds of thousands” of votes yet to be counted. Boockvar was hopeful a clearer picture would be available by Friday morning.
source.name: NBC News

title: 'Let your hand establish this election': Trump's spiritual adviser leads prayer service
description: President Trump's spiritual adviser Paula White lead a prayer service for the outcome of the election at City of Destiny in Apopka, Fla. White said, "I hear the sound of victory" and "We come against the people that are working at high levels."

description: NBC News' Chuck Todd breaks down new election data as two Senate races in Georgia head to a runoff placing control of the Senate in question.

title: Israeli forces demolish Bedouin village in West Bank
description: "The U.S. president is supporting them in everything,” said villager Yousef Abu Awad, “so they thought that whatever they do while he is in office, he has their back.”

title: 'Seen, known and heard': Black readers find education and healing in book clubs
description: Black-centered book clubs like Well-Read Black Girl, Noname Book Club, #BlackLibLit and others pay homage to Black writers while empowering countless others
content:

title: ‘Heartbreaking’: Neighbor reacts to husband who accidentally shot pregnant wife
